```{r}
# sample data
d <- data.frame(expand.grid(x=letters[1:4], g=factor(1:2)), y=rnorm(8))
 
# Figure 1a, 1b, and 1c.
ggplot(d, aes(x=x, y=y, colour=g)) + opts(title="Figure 1a") + geom_line() + geom_point()
ggplot(d, aes(x=x, y=y, colour=g, group=g)) + opts(title="Figure 1b") + geom_line() + geom_point()
ggplot(d, aes(x=x, y=y, colour=g, group=1)) + opts(title="Figure 1c") + geom_line() + geom_point()
```

```{r}
example <- data.frame(country=c("Argentina","Uruguay","Brazil","Argentina","Uruguay","Brazil","Argentina","Uruguay","Brazil"),
                   year=c(2018,2018,2018,2019,2019,2019,2020,2020,2020),
                   value=c(10,12,13,12,14,17,13,13,20))
```

```{r}
ggplot(example,aes(year,value,group=country)) + geom_line()
```

```{r}
#same with color
ggplot(example,aes(x=year,y=value, color = country)) + geom_line()
```
```{r}
rename(health_edu, Val = Value)
```


```{r}
ggplot(subset(health_edu, Indicator == 'Symptoms of Depressive Disorder', Subgroup == 'less than a high school diploma')) +
  aes(x='Time Period',y='Val',group = Indicator) + geom_line()
```


```{r}
ggplot(subset(health_edu, Indicator == 'Symptoms of Depressive Disorder', Subgroup == 'less than a high school diploma')) +
  #summarise(health_edu$ind_mean = mean('Indicator')) %>%
  aes(x = 'Time Period', y = 'Val') +
  geom_line(group = 'Indicator', group = 'Subgroup') +
  ggtitle('TEST') +
  xlab('x test') +
  ylab('y test') +
  #scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, vjust = 1, hjust=1)) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))
```

```{r}
health_edu %>%
  filter(Indicator == 'Symptoms of Depressive Disorder') %>%
  #summarise(health_edu$ind_mean = mean('Indicator')) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = `Time Period`, y = Value)) +
  geom_line(aes(group = Subgroup, color = Subgroup)) +
  ggtitle('TEST') +
  xlab('x test') +
  ylab('y test') +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin=`Low CI`, ymax = `High CI`, group = Subgroup, fill = Subgroup, alpha = 0.1)) +
  #scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, vjust = 1, hjust=1)) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5))
```

